alert.note: Alert for Eastern Toole and Liberty; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 5:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Liberty, southwestern Hill and northwestern Chouteau Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 553 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of The Knees, or 24 miles south of Chester. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Liberty, southwestern Hill and northwestern Chouteau Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Toole and Liberty; Western and Central Chouteau County
